job.title: Open Source Intelligence Analyst
job.description:
Job Number: R0113038

Open Source Intelligence Analyst

The Challenge

Critical decisions are made every single day in our government and military. What if you could use your analytical skills to help them make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an OSINT analyst, you use your specialized language skills, regional and functional knowledge, and your client engagement skills to develop cutting edge research and analysis methods, intelligence products, and analytic assessments to give your client the actionable skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation’s leaders.

As an OSINT analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand mission environment. Using your understanding of various collection and analyst platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you contribute to assessments for senior policymakers. As the authority on your functional and regional area, your client will look to you for timely, critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in OSINT and advanced analytics and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters, nation’s leaders, and policy makers.

Empower change with us.

You Have
  • 3+ years of experience with open source systems, tradecraft, and methodologies to conduct research, collection, or analysis
  • Knowledge of advanced internet-based research, including Boolean logic, advanced research techniques, search engine and database
resources, and resource validation
  • Active TS/SCI clearance
  • BA or BS degree in International Relations or Security Studies
Nice If You Have
  • Experience as a strategic all-source analyst, data scientist, or research assistant
  • Experience with collaborating in multi-functional analytic teams
  • MA or MS degree
  • OSINT Certification
Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Build Your Career

At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and intelligence. When you join Booz Allen, we’ll help you develop the career you want.

Challenging projects – Whether training analysts on military equipment through VR technology; developing a simulation capability to allow teams to rehearse missions together; or integrating RFID tags into mobile devices to enable data access within a geo parameter, you’ll get to solve some of the world’s toughest problems

Meaningful work – Use your skills to empower change. Your work will keep citizens and warfighters safe and well both at home and abroad

State-of-the-art technology – Broaden your intelligence capabilities with digital forensics, telematics, precision navigation, secure mobile operations, and advanced analytics

New skills – In-house experts and partnerships with tech leaders, like Nvidia and Splunk, mean you can get practical experience with advanced GPU technologies, cyber security, and data science

Room to grow – You’ll be inspired to grow your career while making your ideas a reality thanks to new opportunities across the U.S. and abroad, encouraging mentors, and collaborative colleagues

We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.
